experience: You and Kathleen both know Jim McPherson, Andrew Kolikoff, and 9 others
DBA Kathleen M. Bartolomei & UrbanLab LLC

Health Ambassador Initiative: Childhood obesity and healthy, active living initiative with St. Luke’s Health Initiatives (SLHI), Roosevelt School District (RSD), Orchard Community Learning Center, Valley View School Wellness Council, Mountain Park Health Center, South Phoenix Healthy Kids Partnership (SPHKP), Asian Pacific Community in Action (APCA), and students from ASU Schools of Sustainability, Fulton, and Global Health. Designed to give the community, cross-sector, multi-disciplinary experts, and ASU graduate students an applied research lab to experiment with a 360 approach to addressing a community crisis.•Results: Micro level ~ Health Ambassadors (Promotora) pilot group doubled by project end, and included fathers and children, which is atypical of similar Promotora programs in Metro Phoenix. Initiative jumpstarted Orchard Community Learning Center, a community gathering site with 20 family gardens, tilapia farm, and production garden and orchard. Success reinvigorated SPHKP, and created a model for RSD’s new district-wide wellness and nutrition model. Orchard now model for 80 acres of vacant land contiguous to K-8 sites that support RSD’s new $6M Child Nutrition Center and Wellness Initiative.•Results: Macro Level ~ Partners now collaborating in a Collective Impact Technical Assistance Partnership underwritten by SLHI, and a region-wide Collective Impact Partnership with Maricopa County Manager’s Office ~ Special Projects. Expected outcome: Public/Private funding for a large-sector systemic change initiative for South Phoenix.
Board of Directors, VP Membership & Recruitment
Phoenix Citizens Police Academy & Alumni Association

Recruited by Phoenix Police Department to upgrade standards of development and recruitment for the Department’s community outreach initiative with the Citizens Police Academy. Currently developing a three-year strategic plan with phased implementation to recruitment candidates from leadership sector, citizens-at-large, and youth, and create three academies and a sustainable alumni association.

Advisor to Executive Director of the regional one-stop for homeless services in Maricopa County. Raised HSC’s profile in the region, and created strategic relationships with eight new funding partners and strategic allies outside of human services. Created strategy for collective impact with 15 public and private partners operating on HSC’s 12 acre campus, and designed a strategy for social enterprise as a sustainable funding model to mitigate downturn in public and private philanthropy.• Results: Managing agencies received multiple undisclosed minor gifts. Executive Director’s position eliminated amid economic downturn after major donor withdrew RFP.
Corona del Sol High School - Unity Club

Advised Unity Club’s faculty and student leadership in the wake of school violence at Columbine. Founded and facilitated ParentTown, AztecTown’s concurrent parent awareness program. Promoted program during a four-year strategic plan to attract municipal funding stream. Promoted joint venture with Tempe’s Together We’re Better diversity program and MLK Award. First to nominated students and faculty activists for prestigious MLK Award.• Results: Tempe Community Council awarded $5,000 annual grant to Corona del Sol. Re-occurring grants awarded to remaining six campuses in the district totaling $35,000 annually
BA English & California Elementary Teaching Credential (Life)
